newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela sees '97 fiscal surplus of 1.59 pct GDP.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela sees '97 fiscal surplus of 1.59 pct GDP.

text.p: Venezuela's fiscal accounts will end 1997 with an overall surplus equivalent to 1.59 percent of gross domestic product, Finance Minister Luis Raul Matos Azocar said Thursday.
Venezuela recorded its first fiscal surplus for years in 1996 with a cushion equivalent to 0.9 percent of GDP.
"The fiscal situation indicates that for 1997 we'll have a current surplus of 2.69 percent, that is with the total spending of the public sector," Matos told a news conference.
"Now if we include interest payments we have a global surplus of 1.59 percent," he added.
Matos called the news conference to answer accusations from various legislators that recent additional spending requests by the government would make its fiscal surplus target unattainable.
